headline: Microsoft partners with Anthropic and Nvidia in cloud infrastructure deal
summary: Microsoft said Tuesday it is partnering with artificial intelligence company Anthropic and chipmaker Nvidia as part of a cloud infrastructure deal that moves the software giant further away from its longtime alliance with OpenAI.  Anthropic, maker of the chatbot Claude that competes with OpenAI's ChatGPT, said it is committed to buying $30 billion of computing capacity from Microsoft's Azure cloud computing platform.  As part of the partnership, Nvidia will also invest up to $10 billion in Anthropic, and Microsoft will invest up to $5 billion in the San Francisco-based startup.

Anthropic, maker of the chatbot Claude that competes with OpenAI's ChatGPT, said it is committed to buying $30 billion of computing capacity from Microsoft's Azure cloud computing platform.  As part of the partnership, Nvidia will also invest up to $10 billion in Anthropic, and Microsoft will invest up to $5 billion in the San Francisco-based startup.

headline: Microsoft and Amazon Are Downgraded as Redburn Breaks Ranks With Peers
summary: Microsoft Corp. and Amazon.com Inc. saw their ratings cut to neutral from buy on Tuesday, as Rothschild & Co Redburn’s Alexander Haissl downgraded the stocks for the first time since initiating coverage in June 2022, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.  Investors have retreated from AI-related stocks amid unease over stretched valuations.  More than 90% of the analysts covering the stocks have buy-equivalent recommendations on them — with not a single sell rating, according to Bloomberg data.

headline: Cloudflare outage hits OpenAI, the mega paint merger worth $17B
summary: Julie Hyman takes a closer look at the stories behind some of the trending tickers on Yahoo Finance's platform. A Cloudflare (NET) outage hits several sites, including OpenAI's (OPAI.PVT) ChatGPT and Elon Musk's X. Redburn analysts downgrade Amazon (AMZN) and Microsoft (MSFT), raising AI concerns. Akzo Nobel (AKUP.SG) and Axalta Coating Systems (AXTA) are merging to form a $17 billion paint giant. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: AI boom will continue despite bubble fears: Arm CMO
summary: Arm (ARM) Holdings, the semiconductor design company that lists Microsoft (MSFT), Nvidia (NVDA), Meta (META) and Apple (AAPL) among its many partners, expects surging revenue driven by AI - even as fears of a bubble keep growing. Chief Marketing Officer Ami Badani spoke with Ramzan Karmali about the firm's strategy to expand across data centers and mobile devices, while continuing to push for more energy-efficient chips. For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance.

headline: Contradictions Abound for Investors as Nvidia Earnings Loom Large
summary: U.S. stocks are on pace for their worst performance in a November since 2008, while global investors are bullish at a level that hasn’t been seen in more than a decade.  The contrarian signals sum up the challenging backdrop investors face heading into the final weeks of the year, with  Nvidia  earnings on Wednesday likely to define performance in a market beset with concerns over the pace of artificial-intelligence investments and the stretched valuations of the world’s biggest tech stocks.  The  has fallen more than 2.4% for the month, paced by declines in megacap tech stocks, and closed below its 50-day moving average, a key performance benchmark, for the first time on Monday since April.

headline: Bubble or breakout? Nvidia earnings put AI boom under the microscope
summary: (Reuters) -The fate of Wall Street's staggering bets on artificial intelligence will rest squarely on Nvidia on Wednesday when the chipmaker reports results, with investors seeking signs that bubble worries are overblown.  Tech billionaire Peter Thiel's hedge fund sold ‌its entire stake in Nvidia in the third quarter, as has SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son, although he has plowed those returns into a massive bet on OpenAI.  Doubts have pushed Nvidia shares down 7.9% so far in November, after a 1,200% surge in the past three years.

headline: Analysis-Big Tech-led demand for carbon removal credits fuels supply crunch
summary: BELEM, Brazil (Reuters) -Surging demand for high-quality carbon removal credits from tech giants to offset their AI-driven emissions is helping fuel a shortage that experts say is exactly what is needed to spur investment in the nascent market.  Heavy buying over the last two ​years by companies including Microsoft and Google made the credits nearly four times more expensive in 2024 than lower-priced credits pegged to forest-preservation projects.  Big Tech has collectively spent ‌hundreds of millions of dollars since 2019, much of it in the last two years, on durable carbon removals, those that capture and store carbon dioxide for an extended period, the credit experts say.

raw.headline: Analysis-Big Tech-led demand for carbon removal credits fuels supply crunch
raw.summary: BELEM, Brazil (Reuters) -Surging demand for high-quality carbon removal credits from tech giants to offset their AI-driven emissions is helping fuel a shortage that experts say is exactly what is needed to spur investment in the nascent market.  Heavy buying over the last two ​years by companies including Microsoft and Google made the credits nearly four times more expensive in 2024 than lower-priced credits pegged to forest-preservation projects.  Big Tech has collectively spent ‌hundreds of millions of dollars since 2019, much of it in the last two years, on durable carbon removals, those that capture and store carbon dioxide for an extended period, the credit experts say.
